title: 104_s1193
content: The "Medicare Waste and Abuse Reduction Act of 1995" prohibits certain charges from being reimbursed under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, including tickets to entertainment events, gifts, personal use of automobiles, fines, and tuition for providers' spouses or dependents. Competitive bidding is also introduced to reduce wasteful Medicare payments for durable medical equipment and supplies. The "Medicare Waste and Abuse Reduction Act of 1995" introduces competitive acquisition for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The "Medicare Waste and Abuse Reduction Act of 1995" introduces competitive acquisition areas for awarding contracts for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The Secretary establishes competitive acquisition areas based on availability, accessibility of suppliers, and potential savings through competitive bidding. The Secretary establishes competitive acquisition areas for awarding contracts for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act through competitive bidding. Contracts are awarded based on competition among individuals and entities, ensuring access to items and services without reducing availability in rural and underserved areas. The Secretary establishes competitive acquisition areas for awarding contracts for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act through competitive bidding. Contracts are awarded based on competition among individuals and entities who meet quality standards and offer sufficient quantities of items and services to meet expected needs in the competitive acquisition area, ensuring access without reducing availability in rural and underserved areas. The contract specifies the quantity of items and services to be provided and other terms and conditions as required by the Secretary. The Secretary establishes competitive acquisition areas for awarding contracts for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act through competitive bidding. The items and services covered include durable medical equipment, medical supplies, oxygen equipment, and other items deemed appropriate and cost-effective by the Secretary. These items and services must be furnished only through competitive acquisition to ensure access and cost-effectiveness. The Secretary establishes competitive acquisition areas for awarding contracts for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act through competitive bidding. Expenses for items or services in competitive acquisition areas must be incurred by entities other than contracted suppliers, unless in cases of urgent need. The Secretary establishes competitive acquisition areas for awarding contracts for items and services under Part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act through competitive bidding. If the projected payment amount for an item or service does not decrease by at least 10 percent (20 percent for oxygen and oxygen equipment) when furnished through competitive acquisition contracts, the Secretary will reduce the payment amount as necessary to achieve the reduction. These amendments apply to items and services furnished under Part B on or after January 1, 1996. The Secretary will reduce excessive payments for oxygen and oxygen equipment by 20 percent for items furnished between October 1, 1995, and January 1, 1996. Additionally, excessive billings for scooters will now include orthotic body jackets and incontinence supplies. Carrier authority is improved to reduce excessive Medicare payments. Improved carrier authority under Section 1834(a)(10)(B) to reduce excessive Medicare payments by amending Section 1842(b)(8) and repealing Section 1842(b)(9).
